result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kamisha Nicolette Harvey

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kamisha Nicolette Harvey in court.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Kamisha Nicolette Harvey.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17. Review Hearing scheduled
Review hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kamisha Nicolette Harvey in court.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Kamisha Nicolette Harvey.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel informed the Court this case is in deferred prosecution agreement posture and requests a DPA hearing.
Parties are notified the Reserve Branch Judge at the next scheduled court date of 9/29/2022 will be before Judge Konkol.
Case remains calendared in Branch 13.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Kamisha Nicolette Harvey in court.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Kamisha Nicolette Harvey.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD.
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing.
Parties are not ready to proceed and request additional time.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 13.
Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kamisha Nicolette Harvey in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kamisha Nicolette Harvey appeared by video means with Attorney.
Defense counsel informed the Court that this case is being reviewed for DPA.   Court ordered case adjourned for DPA hearing in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Kamisha Nicolette Harvey in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kamisha Nicolette Harvey appeared by video means with Attorney.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Kamisha Nicolette Harvey in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kamisha Nicolette Harvey appeared by video means with Attorney. Defense provided a counter offer which State needs time to review.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kamisha Nicolette Harvey in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Plummer has received discovery and an offer and requests time to review it with his client.  Case is adjourned to Br. 37.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kamisha Nicolette Harvey in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Kamisha Nicolette Harvey in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
